result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Request for Substitution of Judge
Attorney Swank advises defendant waives reading of information and enters NG pleas. Defense advised waives courts appearance for purposes of ARGN. Requests substitution of Judge. PTC set. Bond cont.

11:32 AM Prosecuting attorney Micabil Diaz-Martinez in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Michael Joseph Susajlo in court.  Attorney Lucas Swank in court for Michael Joseph Susajlo. State calls witness, Chief W. Prudlick, sworn in. State examines witness. Defense examines witness. No further questions, no additional witnesses. State moves for bind over. Defense makes argument. Court finds probable cause. State files an information, counts track complaint.

9:39 AM Prosecuting attorney Micabil Diaz-Martinez in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Michael Joseph Susajlo appeared by video, in custody from the TC Jail.  Attorney Lucas Swank appeared by video for Michael Joseph Susajlo. Court advised defendant of rights/max penalties. Defendant waives reading of complaint. PH set. Bond cont.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 10, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on May 10, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection

Defendant not to possess or consume a controlled substance without a valid prescription. Defendant not to possess drug paraphernalia. Defendant is not to possess any syringes. Defendant is to not have contact with any known drug users; defined as anyone with any drug related convictions in the last 5 years, except in a bona fide therapeutic treatment setting.

1:09 PM Prosecuting attorney John Harrison Sacia appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Michael Joseph Susajlo appeared by video, in custody from the TC Jail. State requests cash bond. Defendant makes statement. INIT set. CBS.
Initial appearance scheduled for May 3, 2022 at 09:00 am.
